text: Edward A. Barbour Jr. was an American Democratic politician and lawyer who served in the Missouri General Assembly. He served in the Missouri Senate from 1935 until 1943 and in the Missouri House of Representatives from 1923 until 1925. Barbour was educated at public schools of Springfield, Missouri, Drury College, University of Missouri, and Washington University School of Law in St. Louis. During World War I, he served at the Adjutant General Department of Camp McArthur at Waco, Texas. ==References== ==External links== * The Political Graveyard: Index to Politicians, Barbour Category:20th-century American politicians Category:Missouri Democrats Category:Missouri state senators
title: Edward Barbour
